Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all multiline editors.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from AbstractEditor.

enum AbstractMultiLineEditor::CaretAction
 

Defines the command which can given to the method AbstractMultiLineEditor::NavigateCaret.

Enumerator:
CaretLeft  The caret will be moved one item to the left. If the caret is on the left most border, it will be aligned on the last item of the previous line.
CaretRight  The caret will be moved one item to the right. If the caret is on the right most border, it will be aligned on the first item of the next line.
CaretLineUp  The caret will be moved to the previous line at the same horizontal position if possible.
CaretLineDown  The caret will be moved to the next line at the same horizontal position if possible.

WCHAR &  chr
)  const [virtual]
 

Returns the character at the position index into the output parameter chr.

Parameters:
index Index of the item.
chr Output parameter, which contains the character if the item is an instance of a character.
Returns:
TRUE, if the item on the given index is an instance of a character.

XYDIM AbstractMultiLineEditor::GetContentLeft (   )  const
 

Returns the number of pixels from the left, where the content starts. Normally 0 is returned except the position-indicator is aligned on the left side.

INT AbstractMultiLineEditor::GetLineCount (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Total number of lines inside the editor. For getting the number of visible lines, use AbstractMultiLineEditor::GetVisibleLineCount.

XYDIM AbstractMultiLineEditor::GetMaxContentWidth (   )  const
 

Returns the maximum width in pixels of the content. The width is different from the client-width because of the position-indicator.

INT AbstractMultiLineEditor::GetVisibleLineCount (  BOOLEAN *  line_clipped = 0  )  const
 

Parameters:
line_clipped Optional output-parameter, which is TRUE, when the last visible line is clipped.
Returns:
Number of currently visible lines.

WrapPolicy AbstractMultiLineEditor::GetWrapPolicy (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the wrapping policy which is used for aligning the lines of the document. (see EditorDocument::WrapPolicy for details). Per default EditorDocument::WhitespaceWrap is returned.

void AbstractMultiLineEditor::Layout (  INT  line_idx = 0,
INT  added_items = -1
)  [protected]
 

Triggers a layouting of all lines starting from the line given by line_idx. If items have been added this hint can be given by added_items, which usually results in an optimized layouting performance.

void AbstractMultiLineEditor::SetFirstVisibleLineIndex (  INT  line_idx  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the first visible line index shown on the upper border. The position of the caret won't be modified.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor.

void AbstractMultiLineEditor::SetPositionIndicatorEnabled (  BOOLEAN  flag  ) 
 

Allows to enable or disable the position-indicator. Per default the position-indicator is enabled and hence always shown. Note that it is not possible to show the position-indicator on demand, which means dependend whether the content fits into one page or not.

There are two reasons for this:

  1. The most expensive operation concerning runtime is the layouting of the content, which means calculating the line-breaks dependend on the available width of the editor. To find out, whether a position-indicator has to be shown a layouting has to be done with the maximum width. If the content does not fit into one page, the width decreases by the width of the position-indicator and the layouting has to be redone. This means when editing long texts the layouting has to be done twice, which may result to runtime problems especially for editors with complex content like the multi-media-editor.
  2. Additionally to this runtime problem a usability-problem would be introduced, when the position-indicator is shown dynamically: meanwhile typing a text at the bottom of a page a complete relayout would be the result as soon as the position-indicator is shown, which is quite confusing. This is also the reason why all editors on big desktop-systems don't have a dynamic position-indicator too.

BOOLEAN AbstractMultiLineEditor::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from AbstractEditor.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, and MultiLineEditor.

void AbstractMultiLineEditor::SetUpDownPermitted (  BOOLEAN  flag  )  [inline]
 

If flag is FALSE, the multi-line-editor ignores the arrow-keys for up and down. This might be wanted when a multi-line-editor shares a window with other controls to enable a navigation between the controls by the arrow-keys.

void AbstractMultiLineEditor::SetWrapPolicy (  WrapPolicy  wrap_policy  ) 
 

Sets the wrapping policy which is used for aligning the lines of the document (see EditorDocument::WrapPolicy for details). Per default EditorDocument::WhitespaceWrap is used.
